comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The evening world., January 18, 1916, Final Edition, Image 2 (with photo) reported that Sybil Eden, a Red Cross nurse, arrived at New York on the steamship Tuscania on January 18, 1916. She tramped for over a hundred miles with the Serbian army in the retreat from Belgrade and badly froze her feet.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much for your research, B-59. We'll add some of this information to the record the next time we update.
